720558f-a.text:
490 Hudson Street, east side between Grove and Christopher Street, and Hudson and Bedford Streets, showing P.S. 3.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.

July 8, 1929
720558f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Grove Street, Manhattan, NY

720559f-b.text:
(1)
Hudson Street, east side, north from and including Grove, to and including Christopher Streets, as seen from the U.S. Appraises Stores, and showing a general view eastward. Prominent buildings are (left to right), the Chrysler, N.Y. Life, Metropolitan Life and the Consolidated Gas Co. Note Public School No. 3, at the N.E. corner of Grove Street.
July 25, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
July 25, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
720559f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Grove Street, Manhattan, NY

720560f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, at Grove Street, showing St. Lukes P.E. Chapel; cornerstone laid June 4, 1821. To the right are 3 story structures that extend to Christopher Street. The parish house is the first of these, occupying a doube frontage. This photo was reproduced on page 96 of the published
volume "Changing New York."
June 18, 1936
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
720560f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Grove Street., Manhattan, NY
